hints.content:
At first, $\blueD{225}$ customers picked chocolate as their favorite flavor.


[[☃ image 1]]

Then, $\redC{25}$ customers changed their vote *from* chocolate.

$\blueD{225} - \redC{25} = 200$

After that, only $200$ customers picked chocolate as their favorite flavor.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Ice cream flavor and the vertical axis labeled Number of customers. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry, and Cookie dough. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 25, 50, 75, 100, 125, 150, 175, 200, 225, and 250. The bar line for each Ice cream flavor shows the following: Vanilla bar line extends to 175, Chocolate bar line extends to 225, Strawberry bar line extends to 75, and Cookie dough bar line extends to 200. A blue line is drawn to the right from 225, which reaches to the end of the Chocolate bar line. !

hints.content:
At first, $\purpleD{75}$ customers picked strawberry as their favorite flavor.


[[☃ image 1]]

Then, $\redC{25}$ customers changed their votes *to* strawberry.

$\purpleD{75} + \redC{25} = 100$

After that, $100$ customers picked strawberry as their favorite flavor.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Ice cream flavor and the vertical axis labeled Number of customers. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry, and Cookie dough. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 25, 50, 75, 100, 125, 150, 175, 200, 225, and 250. The bar line for each Ice cream flavor shows the following: Vanilla bar line extends to 175, Chocolate bar line extends to 225, Strawberry bar line extends to 75, and Cookie dough bar line extends to 200. A purple line is drawn to the right from 75, which reaches to the end of the Strawberry bar line. !

hints.content:
We can use dashed lines to show the votes after the change.


[[☃ image 1]]

So, $200$ people picked chocolate and $200$ people picked cookie dough as their favorites.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Ice cream flavor and the vertical axis labeled Number of customers. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry, and Cookie dough. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 25, 50, 75, 100, 125, 150, 175, 200, 225, and 250. The bar line for each Ice cream flavor shows the following: Vanilla bar line extends to 175, Chocolate bar line extends to 225, Strawberry bar line extends to 75, and Cookie dough bar line extends to 200. A purple line is drawn to the right from 200, which reaches to the end of the Cookie dough bar line. Chocolate bar has its dashed lines lowered to the level of purple line from 225 to 200. Strawberry bar has its dashed lines raised from 75 to 100. !

hints.content: After the change, chocolate and cookie dough were the favorite of the same number of customers.

question.content:
The graph shows the favorite ice cream flavors for customers at Dessert Zone.


[[☃ image 1]]

After Dessert Zone made the graph, $25$ people changed their vote from chocolate to strawberry.

**After those $25$ people changed their vote, which $2$ flavors were the favorite of the same number of customers?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Ice cream flavor and the vertical axis labeled Number of customers. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry, and Cookie dough. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 25, 50, 75, 100, 125, 150, 175, 200, 225, and 250. The bar line for each Ice cream flavor shows the following: Vanilla bar line extends to 175, Chocolate bar line extends to 225, Strawberry bar line extends to 75, and Cookie dough bar line extends to 200. !
